00028 #include "util.h"
00029 
00030 void error(const char *msg)
00031 {
00032     perror(msg);
00033     exit(0);
00034 }
00035 /***********************************************************************************/
00036 
00037 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00038 {
00039     char buff[MAX_SZ],read_buff[MAX_SZ];
00040         SOCKET sock;
00041     unsigned int portno,size,sess_type;
00042         int n,i,no_req;
00043         string plugin_name,message;
00044         SSL *ssl_client;
00045         SSL_CTX *ctx;
00046         ssl_client = NULL;
00047         ctx = NULL;
00048 
00049 #ifdef WINDOWS
00050         sock_init();
00051 #endif
00052         memset(buff,0,MAX_SZ);
00053     if (argc < 7) 
00054        error("Usage: sample_client <ip_address> <port> <plugin_name> <message> <no_requests> <1=SSL|0=RAW>");
00055     portno = atoi(argv[2]);
00056         plugin_name = string(argv[3]);
00057         message = string(argv[4]);
00058     no_req = atoi(argv[5]);
00059     sess_type = atoi(argv[6]);
00060         if(sess_type == 1)
00061         {
00062                 if(!ssl_init(&ctx))
00063                         error("ERROR SSL init");
00064                 if(!ssl_connect((unsigned char *) argv[1], portno,sock,&ssl_client,&ctx))
00065                         error("ERROR SSL connecting");
00066         }
00067         else
00068         {
00069                 if(!sock_connect((unsigned char *)argv[1],portno,sock))
00070                 error("ERROR connecting");
00071         }
00072         setblocking(sock);
00073         memset(buff,0,MAX_SZ);
00074         size = create_message(plugin_name,message,buff);
00075         for(i=0; i < no_req; i++)
00076     {
00077                 if(sess_type == 1)
00078                         n = SSL_write(ssl_client, buff,size);
00079                 else
00080                         n = send(sock,buff,size,0);
00081                 if (n < 0) 
00082                         error("write ERROR ..");
00083                 if(sess_type == 1)
00084                         n = ssl_read_socket((unsigned char *)read_buff,sock,&ssl_client);
00085                 else
00086                         n = read_socket((unsigned char *)read_buff,sock);
00087                 if (n < 0) 
00088                         error("read ERROR..");
00089                 cout << "Ctr: " << i << " " << string(read_buff) << endl;
00090                 if(!memcmp(read_buff,"00 TERMINATE",12))
00091                         break;
00092     }
00093         if(sess_type == 1)
00094                 while((SSL_shutdown(ssl_client)) == 0);
00095 #ifdef WINDOWS
00096         closesocket(sock);
00097 #else
00098     close(sock);
00099 #endif
00100     return 0;
00101 }
